Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List:
I learned a lot amount the works of famous photographers. It was especially enjoyable to learn about the stories behind those works and what makes them so impressive. 

I also learned how to fine tune my own pictures through Photoshop and to print them carefully. Throughout the semester, I gained a better eye for how to make my pictures better.
Learn to take good photos and use photoshop for color correction.

I learned how to better use the settings on my DSLR camera, Adobe Bridge & Photoshop basics, how to print pictures on an inkjet printer, and how to better present my work when the pictures are printed and not seen through a screen.

Strengths - great combination of fine tuning students' skills in photography and studying the works of successful photographers. 

Weaknesses - while the time spent individually working on Photoshop was very helpful, it would have been great to have more lesson-style classes where we learn a skill in depth as a class.
Strengths are it's focus on taking good photos. Could use more of a focus on technical sections.

The strengths are definitely the freedom the professor gives to explore different styles of color photography, and how the focus is less on getting the settings perfect and more on the angle, feel and emotion behind the picture. The only "weakness" I see is that I would have wanted a little more practice on the different Photoshop tools in class.
Absolutely! Whether you have experience in photography or not, definitely take it if you are interested!
yes take it with ted he is so chill
If you're at all interested in photography taking this class with Ted is a blast.
I would recommend this course to any student interested in photography regardless of their background (as long as they can get their hands on a DSLR camera). It is an amazing beginners course.
